trias 0.1.0
  • Reference

Pathway count indicator figure

Source: R/get_table_pathways.R
get_table_pathways.Rd

Function to get number of taxa introduced by different pathways. Possible breakpoint: kingdom.

get_table_pathways(df, category = NULL, n_species = 5,
  kingdom = "kingdom")

Arguments

df

df.
category

NULL or character. One of the kingdoms as given in GBIF:

  • "Plantae"

  • "Animalia"

  • "Fungi"

  • "Chromista"

  • "Archaea"

  • "Bacteria"

  • "Protozoa"

  • "Viruses"

  • "incertae sedis"

It can also be one of the following not kingdoms: #'

  • Not Chordata. Default: NULL.
n_species

integer The maximum number of species to return as examples per pathway. For groups with less species than n_species, all species are given. Default: 5.
kingdom

character. Name of the column of df containing information about kingdom. Default: "kingdom".

Value

a data.frame

Examples

library(readr)
datafile <- paste0(
  "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/trias-project/pipeline/master/data/",
  "interim/test_data_output_checklist_indicators.tsv"
)
data <- read_tsv(datafile)
